item.title: Afghanistan: Soldiers flee to Tajikistan after Taliban clashes
item.description: More than 1,000 soldiers retreat to Tajikistan as fighting with the militants intensifies.

item.title: Soul Cap: Afro swimming cap Olympic rejection could be reconsidered after backlash
item.description: The governing body had told Soul Cap their hats don't follow "the natural form of the head".

item.title: Covid: Most rules set to end in England, says PM
item.description: Boris Johnson says the success of the vaccine means England can begin to look beyond restrictions.

item.title: Ever Given: Egypt agrees deal to release ship that blocked Suez Canal
item.description: Egypt agrees a compensation deal with the impounded Ever Given's owners and insurers.

item.title: Watch: The moment dozens of fireworks accidentally explode
item.description: Dozens of fireworks were accidentally set off ahead of the celebrations in Maryland.

item.title: Bill Cosby defends TV wife Phylicia Rashad after she celebrated his release
item.description: Phylicia Rashad tweeted her joy at co-star Bill Cosby's sexual assault conviction being overturned.

item.title: Nigeria kidnap: Gunmen seize 140 schoolchildren in Kaduna state
item.description: The children were seized by a group of armed men from a school in the north-west of the country.

item.title: Pet lion returned to owner after Cambodian PM's intervention
item.description: The animal was seized in the capital Phnom Penh last month after officials said the pet was illegal.

item.title: Miami collapse: Remaining structure demolished over safety fears
item.description: The remaining section of the collapsed building is brought down as teams resume the search for victims.

item.title: Indonesia faces oxygen crisis amid worsening Covid surge
item.description: The government has asked producers to prioritise medical oxygen as hospitals struggle to cope.

item.title: Gang behind huge cyber-attack demands $70m in Bitcoin
item.description: The authors of a "colossal" ransomware attack demand the sum in Bitcoin in return for a key to unlock all files.

item.title: Georgia: Tbilisi Pride cancelled amid violent protests
item.description: Protesters stormed LGBT offices and attacked journalists ahead of the planned march in Tbilisi.

item.title: Russian food firm VkusVill triggers row over lesbian family ad
item.description: There is fury after VkusVill posted an ad showing a lesbian family, then removed it.

item.title: Japan landslide: Elderly couple among survivors pulled from buried homes
item.description: Three people are dead and 80 missing as dozens of homes are buried under a torrent of mud.

item.title: Azerbaijan mud volcano triggers huge blast in Caspian oil and gas fields
item.description: The explosion sent plumes of black smoke and flames into the sky in an oil and gas field.

item.title: Where is the anti-lockdown movement headed?
item.description: What is set to become of the growing anti-lockdown movement once Covid restrictions are lifted?

item.title: Irish boy swaps cash prize for some lovely cows
item.description: Have you herd about the 10-year-old who's creating his own field of dreams after winning â‚¬1,000?

item.title: Israeli city's residents fear for the future
item.description: Both Jewish and Arab Israelis feel unprotected after intercommunal violence in the Israeli city.

item.title: The questions raised by US government's UFO report
item.description: An astronautical engineering expert on the unanswered questions in the US government's UFO report.

item.title: Escaping a serial killer - and moving on
item.description: Kara Chamberlain was kidnapped when she was 15. Now she talks about her trauma on social media.

item.title: What we can all learn from Britney Spearsâ€™ case
item.description: The pop starâ€™s conservatorship has shed light on our treatment of female celebrities in the 2000s.

item.title: Brexit: Exporting my fish to China is easier than to France
item.description: A Scottish fisherman says post-Brexit rules means three hours worth of paperwork for each EU order.

item.title: Indian dowry payments remarkably stable, study says
item.description: Researchers studied 40,000 marriages that took place in Indian villages between 1960 and 2008.

item.title: Is the use of jetpacks finally about to take off?
item.description: Members of the public can now pay to fly through the air like a superhero.

item.title: Delta variant: Which Asian countries are seeing rising cases?
item.description: Some Asian countries are now seeing rising coronavirus infections - is that down to the Delta variant?

item.title: Jeff Bezos steps down as Amazon boss
item.description: As Bezos leaves his role as CEO, those who have worked with him ponder the lessons learned.

item.title: Drugs, dates and disputes at African border crossing
item.description: The Morocco-Algeria border has been closed for decades, despite close ties between the people.

item.title: Nnamdi Kanu's arrest leaves Nigeria's Ipob separatists in disarray
item.description: Igbo separatist leader Nnamdi Kanu was largely ignored until his movement became an armed struggle.

item.title: 'The opportunity to bring happiness for our fans, our nation, is very special'
item.description: England have a "very special opportunity" to make the country happy when they face Denmark in their Euro 2020 semi-final, says Gareth Southgate.

item.title: On the verge of greatness - can Cavendish break Tour stage win record?
item.description: After an eventful week at the Tour de France, it's all falling Mark Cavendish's way, so what does he have to do to break Eddy Merckx's record?

item.title: NHL goaltender Kivlenieks dies after party fall
item.description: Columbus Blue Jackets goaltender Matiss Kivlenieks dies after sustaining a head injury in a fall at a house party.

item.title: South Africa isolating for second time in eight days after positive test
item.description: South Africa are isolating for the second time in eight days after a positive coronavirus test in the squad.

item.title: Anderson takes 1,000th first-class wicket
item.description: England's James Anderson takes 7-19 - including his 1,000th first-class wicket - to help Lancashire reduce skittle Kent inside a session for just 74.

item.title: Man Utd: Are Glazers making amends with Red Devils fans?
item.description: The Glazer ownership spoke directly to fans for the first time in their 16-year reign, but are fans convinced the relationship between them and the club will change?

item.title: Euro 2020: England fans celebrate as Three Lions advance to semi-finals
item.description: Fans react as England beat Ukraine 4-0 to reach Euro 2020 semi-final.

item.title: England into Euro 2020 semi-final: 'England fans transported to unfamiliar world'
item.description: Watching England is not meant to be like this, but Gareth Southgate has got fans believing, writes Phil McNulty.

item.title: Czech Republic 1-2 Denmark: Impressive Danes reach semi-finals
item.description: Denmark's impressive and emotional Euro 2020 campaign continues as they march on to the semi-finals courtesy of a victory over the Czech Republic in Baku.

item.title: 'A signal Italy are here to win Euro 2020' - but agony for 'irreplaceable' Spinazzola
item.description: There has been no better team than Italy at Euro 2020 and they are now two games from glory after dumping out Belgium - so how far can they go?

item.title: Euro 2020 last-16 knockout stage fixtures
item.description: All you need to know from Euro 2020, who faces who in the semi-finals, plus when and where to watch the games.

item.title: 'Coercion and rape': Investigating my yoga school
item.description: Ishleen Kaur was passionate about yoga movement Sivananda, until she found allegations of sexual abuse.

item.title: British Jews' fear and defiance amid record monthly anti-Semitism reports
item.description: Some 460 anti-Semitic incidents were reported to the Community Security Trust from 8 May to 7 June.

item.title: A fake wedding, and a $250,000 scam
item.description: How a British man's dreams of a future with his Ukrainian fiancee ended in financial disaster.

item.title: Covid quarantine hotels: Women say they were sexually harassed by guards
item.description: One woman tells the BBC a security guard employed by G4S mimed sex while they were alone in a lift.
